ports.name: Client Name
ports.text: The name of your project / your name, can be freely set.

ports.name: Broker URL
ports.text: The URL of the MQTT-broker. We recommend using [shiftr.io](https://shiftr.io)

ports.name: Username
ports.text: Your username to access the MQTT broker, you need to set up a user-account for that or use the public namespace `try` / `try`.

ports.name: Password
ports.text: The password fitting to your username

ports.name: Port
ports.text: The port the MQTT-server is running on. As cables runs in a HTTPS-environment only secure ports can be used to access a MQTT-broker (MQTTWSS). Only change this if you know what you are doing.

ports.name: Use SSL
ports.text: See [Port](#Port [Value]). Should be checked for most use-cases

ports.name: Reconnect
ports.text: Executes a reconnect to the MQTT broker. If things donâ€™t work out this might help. Otherwise a reload of the page can be a solution. If you enter new login-data (username / password) you also need to reconnect.

ports.name: MQTT Object
ports.text: Contains MQTT-messages and general data, used for the communication between cables MQTT-ops.

ports.name: Connected
ports.text: If the MQTT-op connected successfully. Please note that a connection can time-out, but it will still show as connected.
